snippet: Valeant Pharmaceuticals disclosed that Goldman Sachs sold nearly 1.3 million shares in the drug maker, which were being held as collateral for a loan extended to Valeant’s chief executive.
abstract: Valeant Pharmaceuticals chief executive J Michael Pearson has been forced by Goldman Sachs to sell almost 1.3 million of his shares in company to cover loan that bank gave him.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: Valeant Pharmaceuticals disclosed that Goldman Sachs sold nearly 1.3 million shares in the drug maker, which were being held as collateral for a loan extended to Valeant’s chief executive.

headline.main: Valeant’s Chief Forced to Sell Company Shares He Pledged Against Loans
headline.print_headline: Valeant’s Chief Forced to Sell Company Shares He Pledged Against Loans
